author: Joseph Aubourg
text: 'Great food'

author: Tiffany Lee
text: 'The best place to go with small kids! Great
column5: friendly staff and the food is consistently good!  We have been to this place a lot so that’s a review in and of itself. After having a little one it has been difficult to find places to accommodate having a stroller. Urban has been so amazing with not just having one stroller but accommodating several moms with several strollers.'

author: Ralph Quinones
text: 'Pizza here is amazing
column5: love the pepperoni.'

author: Young K
text: 'Love the foods especially the fried calamari and chicken wings!'

author: Mark K
text: "Get the margherita pizza... It's perfect!! 🤤"

author: Ariel Tranquilli
text: "Called to place an order. The woman clearly didn't speak english that well. After 4 minutes of giving her all my contact info for delivery... I asked if I can upgrade an appetizer to an entrée. She didn't understand my question... got annoyed that she couldn't understand my question then HUNG UP on me. I had to call back 3 times before she'd answer again then she blamed it on being disconnected. CANCELLED my order & didn't bother calling me back. HORRIBLE customer service. The manager wasn't any help either. Been in Hoboken 10 years and I'm a huge foodie
column5: too bad they will not be getting any of my business & I'm happy to tell everyone I welcome into Hoboken about their horrible attitude as well."

author: Rosa I Ramos
text: 'Our service was amazing and the chicken nuggets!!!'

author: Regina Jaslow
text: 'Nice gourmet pizza options!'

author: K. __
text: 'The location is lively and fun to walk around and explore especially on Friday and saturday nights. The restaurant looks nice from the outside
column5: it looks like something you’d find in Manhattan. When we got there we were ignored twice by waiters and hostess. The waiter who served us was kind. The pizza was bland
column6: it lacked a rich flavor and sitting outside made the pizza colder by the second. The spinach artichoke appetizer came in big chunks with barely any cheese in it. Nothing looked appealing nor something that I would want to take a photo of. The fried calamari was good.  The seating arrangement was odd—pushed up against each other; It took away from the private setting of a dinner. Overall
column7: I would not come back here  nor recommended this place to friends. There are much better spots in town just look at the reviews.'

author: Brad Carr
text: 'The pizza was amazing!!!'

author: Rachel B
text: '10/10 delicious! Mud pie and spinach artichoke pizza worth a try. Great service.'

author: J Q
text: "Absolute worst service you can imagine! Had reservations tonight but the service was a disaster. The waitress was nowhere to be found and the place was dead 2 tables in and 2 tables outside (incl mine)!\nWe sat outside but we're completely ignored!  I went in twice to order desserts
column5: but my husband ended up asking for the check after my failed attempts. The present staff did not offer help but continued to hang out amongst each other but told me they were short-staffed. They could have quickly assisted but instead said the waitress would be with us ASAP.\nRuined our night!"

author: wrenwrenegade
text: 'I’ve never signed in to google to give a rating before
column5: but the burger I just ate was so good
column6: I logged in
column7: still hypnotized
column8: just to give 5 stars. I got the UHC burger. This burger was so good
column9: I felt my pupils dilate. This burger was so good
column10: I had to pause Netflix and take a minute to process how delicious it was. I think I saw god in that burger. I suspect I will dream about that burger. I felt things a man has never made me feel from eating that burger. God bless this restaurant.'

author: yoan ante
text: "Penne vodka was just allright. The portion wasn't small but for the price I was expecting more."

author: G Morales
text: 'Lov this place...pizza wings octopus n all their food is great'

author: Cuong Chuong
text: 'The food is good but nasty customers service the hosting & catering staff r so impolited'

author: Schiltz Can
text: 'Someone should teach that asian hostess to be polite and smile.'

author: Michael Milazzo
text: 'Large portions
column5: personal pizzas
column6: eggplant and chicken parm good…friendly staff..'

author: Roschel Davis
text: "I found this place looking for Gluten Free options. They offer a coal oven GF pizza which Ive never had until then. The pizza was good
column5: Ive had better GF pizza it's a toss up sometime with the dough. Otherwise the place is spacious
column6: nice decor
column7: clean and the bathroom smells amazing! The calamari & wings was excellent!! Our server was great too
column8: I cannot recall his name but he was very helpful."

author: Gene Rabinovich
text: 'Enjoyed lunch at this easygoing pizza joint and bar today. This is one of their three locations in NJ and the only one in Hoboken. Coal-fired oven pizza is their specialty and I must say
column5: their pepperoni pizza did not disappoint with crispy slices of pepperoni peppering a superb pie. The place is great for a casual meal with family and friends.'

author: karen jackson
text: 'really nice staff. we felt bad coming in an hour before close (last call at 930) but they were great and pizzawas really good'

author: Carmine Inteso
text: 'Excellent pizza and drinks!! Kelly the bar tender is attentive
column5: funny
column6: and definitely knows how to make a drink!'

author: wanda rodriguez
text: "Mondays are $5 off artisan pizzas. We had a pizza with pepperoni
column5: sausage
column6: and meatballs....named the Don something (my friend says Don Cheadle
column7: but she's drunk).  Anyways

author: Athia Perez
text: 'Very very good!!!! Great place'

author: Chef Joe Balli
text: 'Stopped in here to just kill some time pretty cool place bartender are cool. Beer was alittle warm
column5: pizza was pretty good great crust sauce was ok. Over all pretty good place I would come back.'

author: Malory Wood
text: 'The service was stellar and the food was great! Love the vibe there.'

author: Hector Perez (myThumbsUpRealtorHector)
text: 'Love working from here. Amazing pizza. Epic wings     Don’t tell anyone about the fried avocado fingers! 🤫'

author: Chris Markstrum
text: 'The apple salad with roasted chicken and Don Gregorio pizza were delicious. Great service.'

author: Cassandra Jones
text: 'Our server was attentive albeit slow in greeting us
column5: but she was very kind and accommodating to my request to close the door leading to their outdoor area as it was very cold. Wings and salad was good
column6: specialty drink - forgot what it was called but had pineapple and bourbon - was to die for. Plain cheese pizza was meh. I’d return based on the other items and the service. Hostess was very kind as well.'

author: Megan Gillen
text: 'Went here for lunch a few weekends ago and the service and food was great. I felt that the restaurant was taking all the appropriate covid precautions and had no issues. I’d definitely go back to try their other brunch/lunch foods!'

author: Mell Me*l
text: 'The best sangria'

author: George Heskett
text: 'Awful experience! Called up and was told that they do not take reservations
column5: to then turn up at the door to be told that they only take reservations by Opentable! I was told by the lady at the door that when I called it was ‘insinuated’ to me that I was told this! Teach your staff in the future to explain this....'

author: Frank Murillo
text: 'The wings and the pizza were excellent
column5: very nice staff
column6: everything was perfect'

author: Steven Prida
text: 'Food was good
column5: and satisfying. Nice variety of menu options and portions were respectable. Restaurant was clean and tables spaced apart appropriately. Overall good vibes and environment.\n\nUnfortunately during the 6 to 7 pm hours seem extremely busy and they actually had to stop sitting tables while we were eating. Our server was friendly and helpful. Very attentive as well but since it was so busy it took some time for our food to come. Seems like they just need more staff on to bettering accommodate everyone.'

author: Jessica Aguirre
text: 'Their wings are super good!! Unique and tasty.'

author: Deirdre Morris
text: 'Gluten free pizza is excellent. Highly recommend.'

author: Warlord Jay
text: 'Excellent food and service'

author: Gleisys Rodriguez
text: 'I have ordered so many different plates from here and it never disappoints me. Great food.'

author: Maria Boca
text: 'I ordered a margarita pizza
column5: ended up getting an excuse of a pizza with only sauce
column6: no cheese or basil. Called the restaurant and the manager was really unprofessional and didn’t offer any solution.'

author: Olga Smith
text:
'(Translated by Google) I loved. My daughter took me to eat pizza and it was delicious 🍕😋

(Original)
Me encantó. Mi hija me llevo a comer pizza y estaba riquísima 🍕😋'

author: Adrian John
text: 'Great bar food. Mike is a great server.'

author: chris kay
text:
"Best wings I've ever had !!

Garlic bread and chicken parm top notch too.
Very good sangria to wash it down"

author: Alex Brooks
text: 'Good food
column5: service was lacking. Maybe just understaffed'

author: THGI
text: 'This restaurant is not recommended.  Our experience was awful due to lack of heating indoors on a 40degree day. Poor service
column5: as the waitress was also the bartender and the busboy.  Quality of the food was below average.  Pizza had little to no cheese.  Cocktails were horrible.'

author: Kristy George
text: 'Great menu. Good variety of "different" American style cuisines. Everything has a nice touch to it. Never ordered something my husband or I was disappointed in.'

author: Steve Landfield
text: 'Nic looking place with good beer selection but it was freezing cold in there. Everyone
column5: including the waitresses were wearing coats. What fun is it drinking a beer in a freezing cold bar?'

author: Mauro Briceno
text: 'One of the best pizzas in town. Also half off on the Sangria and 5 starts for the sangria as well. Loved this place. Gluten free pizza as well.'

author: Kiara Robinson
text: 'I went there tonight for some wings and a few drinks on a Saturday night. There was a nice flow of people and my server Jay was amazing super attentive and a pleasure to have. He was funny and always checks for me and makes sure I’m enjoying myself. Excellent food and amazing service from Mike and Jay. It made it really memorable especially since I came solo! Great place my servers really made the experience!'

author: Michael Evangelista
text: 'Great atmosphere and social distance is enforced. I will definitely go back post pandemic to see if the relaxing atmosphere still is the same.'

author: Osborn Focht
text: "Nice place
column5: but I went for their special calamari
column6: and it wasn't on the menu. Server didn't know about it. So
column7: I will go again."

author: Linette Lucas
text: "I have spent lots of money at this restaurant on many occasions.  My 'order was incorrect and they didn't even bother to make it right.  So this is the last time I will be ordering there."

author: Chris Dangelo
text: 'Pizza was good and wings were good... Nothing to blow your socks off.  was a nice change tho ..'

author: Philip Mierswa
text: "Large serving sizes
column5: if you're into that sort of thing. Great drink selection."

author: Michael Bloomberg
text: 'Good food and service.  Many different pizza options and also have gluten free options.  My mom is gluten free and said this was her favorite gluten free pizza she’s ever had!'

author: lily
text: 'Amazing experience! Despite deciding to eat here last minute
column5: we did not have to make a reservation and seating our group of four was almost immediate. The waitress that served us was very patient and gave us time to decide what we wanted to order and throughout our delicious meal
column6: she would check on us to making sure we were OK'

author: veronica manning
text: 'Iove their food so much...especially the pizza'

author: Alexis J.
text: 'First dining experience at a restaurant since March with my husband and 2 little kids. Didn’t think to make a reservation when we saw at least of the tables OUTSIDE were empty. Upon asking for a table
column5: we were told we could ONLY sit inside without a reservation. I immediately went on open table and got a reservation for 5 minutes after we were just told we needed one. Although many tables were open
column6: the hostess then walked us to the last table; one of edict was similar to other seated patrons who were in groups of one 2 or 3. We were 4 with 2 kids.\n\nWe then ordered within 10 minutes of being sat. We ordered 2 appetizers
column7: 2 pizzas
column8: and a kids pasta. 10 minutes later
column9: our wings come to our table with a hair baked right into the chicken. They immediately took it back (later off the bill) but our pizzas (entree) came to our table a minute later. Our table could not hold our food so we had to put our waters or empty cups on the floor. They refused to add a small table to our table because they “had reservations” coming in 30minutes so we could use a second smaller table only up until the reservation arrived.\n\nAll in all
column10: they’re food was good but I’d recommend just picking it up if you really wanted it that badly. If it wasn’t for my kids being hungry after reading the menu and excited to go out to eat for the first time in 7months
column11: I probably would have left the moment the hair showed up in my food.'

author: Idris Ibikunle
text: 'Great'

author: Audrey Jacobson
text: 'I spent time with my daughter and had good pizza!'

author: Adam Zaloum
text: 'Fantastic menu
column5: typically good service
column6: good beer selection. Suggest parking in the parking Garage where Avis is -- parking is scarce in weekends here'

author: AB
text: 'This is right around the corner from my apartment and often my go-to. Love their sangria
column5: brunch cocktails
column6: wings
column7: calamari
column10: but everything is good). Last time I went
column11: there was a very sweet Italian waitress who struck up conversation with my parents and I
column12: she really just next-leveled the experience :)'

author: André Caruso
text: 'Delicious pizza.'

author: Wendy 4141
text:
'(Translated by Google) It is a place to enjoy the outdoors.

(Original)
Es un lugar para disfrutar al aire libre.'

author: Jackie Langella
text: 'Absolutely delicious! I had the San Danielle pizza and it was SO good. The pizza was thin and the crust was soft and airy with a nice crisp to it. The sauce has a signature light sweetness that contrasts the saltiness of the prosciutto very well. My server Michael had great energy and I was well taken care of and didnt have to wait for anything. I also really enjoyed the music they play as well.'

author: James Hampton
text: 'Our 1st seat had water from the a.c. above us dripping on me.  Food was ok but not great.'

author: L. Jason Smith
text: 'Great food...service could be better.'

author: Lesly Ramirez
text: 'Ordered the personal pie to go and it was delicious my boyfriend got the bacon personal pie and it was scrumptious!'

author: Richard Camacho
text: 'The food here is great very fast delivery the quality of the food is very very good ...... first time ordering and very very impressed Thank you guys for serving excellent quality food'

author: Kristina Bodnya
text: 'The quality of food - wow. With so many restaurants getting worse or even closed now
column5: this place cooks such delicious dishes. We’ve ordered parmigiana penne
column6: chicken noodle soup and eggplant rollatini
column7: everything was perfect and huge portions👍🏻'

author: Marie Makaroff
text:
'Hi! I am giving  1 star because the pizza I ordered today was too far away from the pizza I have ordered. I have payed for a large pepperoni pizza. But what I got was six pieces hardly covered with sauce dough.
When my kids saw that pizza they thought mama is broken!!!
When you see in the menu “ large pizza” and pay $25 for that - do you expect just six slices?!!
Never again. This is very dissappinting friday pizza. I really wanted to support local business. But never again to this place.'

author: Danielle Holden
text: "Good food & vibes! Artisan pizzas are flavorful - we've had the Brussels Sprout pizza
column5: Margherita and San Danielle before
column6: all great. I suggest going to a trivia night
column7: which is a chill but fun time."

author: Marybeth Weiss
text: "Went here for Trivia on a Saturday. It was a good crowd with great service. I'll definitely be back!"

author: Gary Cohen
text: 'Food and atmosphere'

author: Musa kamalı
text: 'Delicious pizzas'

author: Ben and Stef Thornberg
text: "Great place for a beer and a date... maybe not in that order. I'd highly recommend the beer."

author: Nic D'Amato
text: 'I won Bingo'

author: Raj Ugrani
text: 'Their pizzas are better than average and then service is really fast; you kinda feel that you have come to a fast food joint 😜 The lady who served us seemed a little agitated
column5: not sure why. They have a unique garlic bread; coal fired and has cheese on it
column6: and it was good!'

author: David Neves
text: 'Unbelievable pizza
column5: great salad
column6: and good beer selection'

author: saya666sai
text: 'The food is good
column5: loved the service
column6: but a bit cramped.'

author: Jacob Ben
text: 'Food was great.  As always.'

author: Mike Burke
text: 'This is one of my go to bar’s in the area. There’s always a decent crowd but they’re never rowdy or too full up. Fantastic choice of beers and selection of drinks
column5: they’ve always got some kinda homemade cocktail or sangria type drink.\n\nFood is fantastic and honestly well priced for quality and amount. Make friends with the staff
column6: they’re amazing people and will make your time much more enjoyable.'

author: Simon Jessey
text: 'When I walked in with my wife the last time we were there
column5: the floor was dirty with bits of trash lying around. The service was slow and there was a lot of unnecessary waiting around. It was better when we were able to sit outside at the end of summer\n\nBut the pizza
column6: and the garlic bread in particular
column7: were absolutely delicious. For this reason
column9: but perhaps it would be better as a place to get takeout.'

author: Ilya Mamin
text: 'Ordered pizza but it came cold. What’s even worse is that it tastes like a frozen pizza heated in an oven. I bet they have premade frozen dough.\n\nThe worst pizza I have ever tried in my lifetime.'

author: Andres FLT
text: 'Try Tuesday specials !!!'

author: Nilesh Parikh
text: 'I love the pizza and I love the ambiance. Great place overall for a great meal'

author: Mohamed Taz
text: 'Pizza'

author: julie foster
text: 'Very good pizza'

author: Greg Piesco
text: 'Good prices. Nice staff and good pizza'

author: Todd P
text: 'Fantastic soup and arugula salad.'

author: Sean McCarthy
text: 'Ordered pizzas from here through seamless. Food never arrived. Staff wasn’t very helpful when I called to figure out where my food was. Food is good here but wouldn’t ever order through seamless again'

author: Lauren MacAllister
text: 'I am editing a review where I recently gave the Urban CoalHouse one star.  I am so thankful to management for reaching out and following up about my experience.  I received a gift card in the mail to go back and try again.  My boyfriend and I went this past Sunday 9/29/19.  Our Server Justin Cage was great and super attentive.\nWe each got pizza and shared the calamari and were very pleased with our meals.  We came to watch the football game and stayed for over 3 hours.  The sangria was a huge highlight for me.\nI am so grateful to management for reaching out
column5: for our great server Justin Cage
column6: and our amazing food.\nI will definitely be back!'

author: Rajeev Raina
text: 'Fantastic breakfast and brunch options'

author: Rodrigo Nogueira
text: 'Excellent pizza (light and tasty in the coal fired oven). Very good beer selection
column5: nice music
column6: nice place overall.'

author: maz kash
text: "Absolutely excellent! All the food was great and fresh. The wait staff were super friendly and professional! Outdoor seating was great and they are very roomy for bringing an infant. Also the price point is very fair. Artisan pizzas at other places I've paid double and they weren't half as delicious!  This will be our new family spot for a good pizza!"

author: Mitali Jain
text: 'It is a nice pizza place trying to replicate the taste with the pizzas in NYC. I ordered a White pizza which was made fresh and had a good taste. Though
column5: after it was cold
column6: it tasted a bit dry. I will definitely try the one with the sauce next time. Sure to be visited often.'

author: Nicólas C
text: "Came on a rainy summer afternoon
column5: they had covered outdoor seating for my pup and I. It was perfect
column6: they brought him water right away a.k.a straight Vodka (just kidding). I got the octopus salad which was delicious along with the margarita pizza which was also delicious. Lydia
column7: our hostess was excellent
column8: very pleasant to talk with. Excellent service! I would definitely recommend this restaurant especially if you'd like to go somewhere with the pup."

author: DeeLorri Photobooths
text: 'Had a lot of fun catching up with family. The food is great! So are the staff and the sangrias.'

author: Kim Delaney
text: "The food here is awesome! Whether it's pizza or pasta you are craving
column5: you can't go wrong with your choice. I came here after the NYC pride parade 2019
column6: but I was very disappointed to find out they were no longer serving rum buckets. I was told they were discontinued. This was the main reason we all went there. The food was excellent however very sad about the rum buckets. It was kind of a let down to find this out after such a fun day."

author: Kenny Freeman
text: 'Usually have really good happy hour specials. Have yet to try anything here that I disliked'

author: Alan Klayman
text: 'Good food.  Great location.  Quick (but a little curt) service.  Great open area right on 14th st in bustling Hoboken NJ.  Very popular for a number of these reasons.'

author: SMOOTH STEVE
text: 'We stopped here because my son has a gluten allergy and we happy to find that everything on the menu was delicious. We are definitely going back!\n\nI don’t usually give reviews but this restaurant deserved 5 stars!'

author: Laurie Quinn
text: 'Love this place to eat alfresco and people watch. Delicious food and great service'

author: Brett Hladczuk
text: 'Unique and solid. This describes pretty much everything about this place.'

author: Tebo
text:
'(Translated by Google) Cozy place

(Original)
Cosy place'

author: kmason
text: "I highly recommend Urban CoalHouse Pizza & Bar. Today was my 2nd follow up visit after a 3 star rating then a 4 star rating a few months ago. I left the history of my prior visit below.\n\nWith the prior follow up visit I added the 4th star and this time
column5: added a fifth star. Good work CoalHouse team!!!\n\nPerfect crust
column6: delicious cheese and sauce with basil to perfection
column7: and Apple Salad which as always
column8: was maximum fresh and crispy with tasty dressing.\n\nAs a rule I don't mention names but since my first negative rating was all about poor service
column9: I want to mention that this 5 star rating was in great part due to our server Michael
column10:
and the excellent and highly professional attention he gave to my family today. Thank you Michael and I hope your boss (who is also doing a great job) reads this review.

PRIOR REVIEW BELOW

Follow up visit after prior review. This trip a much better experience. The food quality was very good
column12: very good pizza crust and toppings. A good menu selection for all including tasty vegetarian choices.\n\nToday the place was full of energy
column13: tables and bar area were packed
column14: and though the food came out a little slow due to the crowd size
column15: it wasn't an issue because the the servers were fast
column16: positive and did a great job under pressure.\n\nI recommend Urban CoalHouse and it's great to see management's success at addressing issues and keeping this a fun
column17: refreshing place for ice cold beer
column18: friends and a family pizza gathering. Thank you!"

author: Swim Team
text: 'Great place'

author: pamela m
text: 'Great tasting pizza.  It was packed when I went'

author: pallavi kapadia
text: 'Very good food and good service'

author: Henry Thompson
text: 'Delicious wings and gluten free pizza. There’s daily specials as well. Nice staff'

author: Sai Ram
text: 'Hell yeah! Great ambiance and food'

author: Oda Simi
text: 'Big fan of the food here.  Interior is very nice and there is a great vibe on the weekends.  Excellent joint for a beer.'

author: Hakeem L
text: 'I love it. The beers are great the bartenders are better'

author: Wang April
text: 'I ordered San Danielle which means there should be Arugula and Prosciutto on it. However
column5: I just got the plain pizza and when I called back to the restaurant. The guy in the restaurant was so rude
column6: said ‘ I can do nothing’ and hang up the phone without any apologies. By the way
column7: the pizza is cold.'

author: Chris Bateman
text: 'Really nice meal. The pizza is wonderful'

author: Ievgenia Zozulynska
text: 'Eggs Benedict were hard boiled
column5: some hiccups with the order from kitchen. I guess you need to go with pizza or wings to have it right.'

author: Noemi Graham
text: 'Food taste good love the wings
column5: best gluten free pizza.'

author: Tierra Edmunds
text: "Good drinks
column5: friendly staff
column6: nice atmosphere. Didn't try the food
column7: but the bartender makes a great Red Devil!"

author: John Monteverde
text: 'Great artichoke and spinach pizza. Meatballs and chicken tenders were a big hit for grandson.'

author: Frank Scarola
text: 'Ordered two very expensive pies delivered
column5: received  a margarita instead of the special with prosciutto they were both undercooked and barely warm. The white pie was so bad nobody would eat more than a slice.'

author: Michelle Kourakin
text: 'Trivia on Saturday nights!'

author: Ravi Bhankharia
text: 'Great all day happy hour on Saturdays.'

author: Scott Lagattuta
text: 'Good pizza'

author: Tooligans
text: '3 out of 5... chicken parm too soupy!'

author: James McCabe
text: "Didn't have the grilled octopus.  But the wings were a good alternative."

author: Kelly C
text: 'Atmosphere and music were great. Came out for a Galentine’s day dinner and the service exceeded expectations for such a busy night. Sarah was great and made sure we always had what we needed. Shishito pepper appetizer was awesome. Definitely go for the Don Gregorio and San Danielle pizzas. 10/10 would recommend.'

author: Malcolm Freeman
text: 'Food was pretty good. Nothing super amazing. Service was atrocious though. Lost big points for that.'

author: Sha Meek
text: 'Great service
column5: great environment and great pizza!'

author: WIGGED OUT with Michael
text: 'Great Pizza and excellent staff!'

author: Jacks K
text: 'Worst place to order delivery from! I ordered food and everything came back COLD! When I called them to ask if they have pizza warmers like other places
column5: they claim they did. Then
column6: the guy hung up in my ear... definitely DO NOT order from these people! Waste of $ and overpriced.'

author: Ryan Sharp
text: 'Great pizza'

author: Rebecca Kissmer
text: "Unfortunately being in downtown Hoboken
column5: I don't get here very often since it's so far north. But every time I have been I have loved it! Some of the best slices and pies of artisan pizza in the area with friendly and helpful service. They also have a half price cocktail and wings night on Tuesdays. Would definitely recommend this place. Yum!"

author: steven revello
text: 'Not great pizza. Bland'

author: Zachary Meli
text: 'The pizza is very good. Wings are with onions and enjoy them. Service can be good or so-so. Place gets packed!'

author: Stan Syvash
text: "Honestly
column5: Really Good Pizza.\n\nLived in Brooklyn for 15 years
column6: so right off the bat
column7: it's nothing like a classic by-by the-slice pizzeria.\n\nYou have to order Full Pies
column8: and they are a little on pricier (9/m15/L18 for regular
column10: L18 for artisan pies)\n\nThe quality of ingredients reflect the price.  I have tried half the pizzas and have never been disappointed
column11: and always pleasantly surprised!\n\nAppetizers are delicious as well (wings
column12: brussels sprouts!!)\n\nService can be lacking (in terms of courtesy
column15: at least on the week days) even when it's not at all busy
column16: which is something the owners should look in to ( ! )\n\nVery Good Beer Selection
column19: especially if you stick to delivery.  5 solid stars\n\nP.S. This place gets very busy on the weekend
column20: and delivery can be very slow (2.5hrs!!).   110% suggest ordering from UberEats for fast delivery."

author: Carlos Sotomayor
text: "Service and food were great
column5: excellent brunch options I'll definitely comeback to try their pizza
column6: overall a great experience."

author: Aida Ayala (Alo)
text: 'For brick oven pizza it was good waiter needs to be less attitude and more intentive to customer ....eat out'

author: Saquina Hyman
text: 'Great chicken tenders the sauce is so good!'

author: John Burdett
text: 'Too busy on Halloween'

author: Lauren Maddaloni
text: 'Pretty quick service and the food came out fast. I got the butternut squash soup (which was gluten free) but could have been a little hotter. The gluten free pizza was pretty good as well it was interesting that the cheese was on the bottom and the sauce was on top.'

author: Michael Quill
text: 'Eat at the bar or can get a table.\nGood looking food.'

author: Ruben Valdez
text: 'Food was pretty good
column5: the drinks were excellent'

author: gilbert rodriguez
text: 'Good food
column5: fair price. Nice atmosphere.'

author: Michael Martin
text: 'Place should be so much better than it is. Continually get order wrong when you order by phone. They also never answer their phone when you call. I just called for over ten minutes before finally getting an answer. This is at 2pm on a Friday
column5: not even a busy time. Service varies on your server. Last weekend we sat at at table for close to ten minutes without even being acknowledged. Unfortunate because food is generally decent which I guess is why I keep coming back to it.'

author: Andres Sanchez
text: 'This place is great
column5: I love their wings and pizza. I used to do their trivia nights as well when I had the time. Highly recommend coming here for a quick bite or as a sit down dinner. The wings are the best!'

author: Paddu Kapadia
text: 'Excellent food and good service'

author: Matt Donders
text: 'Want a good lunch in uptown Hoboken? Then look no further. The pizza and sandwiches here are absolutely delicious and not just your standard meat and cheese pizzas. The beer & drink selection is great and the staff is super friendly.\n\nWhen it gets nice out they open all the doors or can you even sit outside. Highly recommend everything about this place!'

author: Sydney Slavik
text: 'Urban Coalhouse is an all around go-to spot for any situation: bringing friends & family
column5: lunch
column6: or casual drinks. Favorites include the wings and half-off sangria on Wednesdays. They have also been adding new specials to their menu recently!'

author: Leyla Bascombe
text: 'We went there with my husband at Sunday night to have some dinner and we really like it was so many people. The girl who took our orders was very nice. We definitely will be back))'

author: daniel jackson
text: "I don't normally review but just ordered the Penne Bolognese through Uber Eats and it was bangin'.  Don't change a thing.  Best I've had in years."

author: Christine F
text: "Great service - we were greeted and served right away
column5: and the bartender was friendly. They have a good beer list
column6: though they'd recently had a tap takeover so it seemed a little different than what we might be able to expect on a typical night. Nice atmosphere."

author: Neen Hankins
text: 'I ordered pizza and wings and food food was AH-MAZING. We ordered drinks and the bartender put to kuch ginger in it. The second drink they actually put less ginger in it. The waiter was great and very attentive! Awesome spot!'

author: Glenn Coogan
text: 'Great Salads and Garlic Bread'

author: Ravon Anderson
text: 'Food was good. Nice atmosphere and setting.'

author: Tanea Çhoudhury
text: 'Amazing atmosphere and great
column5: tasty pizza!'

author: Lindy Pagan
text: 'Pizza arrived iced cold & tasted kind of funny too. Awful.'

author: John Keegan
text: 'Nice place. Wings Apple salad and pizza very good.'

author: Maria Lopez Cavestany
text: "I mostly come here for the happy hours that they have almost every day after 4pm
column5: especially the Tuesday one. They serve amazing $5 mixed drinks
column6: I always get the cucumber mojito or the saint martin if I want something that's sweeter! The pizzas are also really good too!"

author: Thomas Nesbit
text: 'Food is fantastic!'

author: Nik E
text: 'Meh. All food lacks taste. Pizza is decent'

author: Linda Snyder
text: 'All our food was great except the artichoke pizza. Slices of artichoke were to think and not cooked.'

author: Liliana Ortiz Sierra
text: 'Love it'

author: Gregory Gioia
text: 'Great pizza and beer selection'

author: Stephen Cosby
text: "Happy hour pricing is good
column5: however
column6: based on the buffalo chicken pizza
column7: the pizza here is not too good. Don't come here if you're looking for NY style pizza.  This is just pizza. It was dry and not too many ingredients. The wings were pretty amazing
column9: and they are also on the happy hour menu. Try them out!"

author: Edwin
text: 'The chicken parm and the garlic bread is delicious. Plus the pizza is really good.'

author: Gary Peterson
text: "Crust on the pizza was like cardboard and when there is almost as many employees as their are patrons and you sit for almost ten minutes with an empty glass it doesn't say much about the service. I don't plan on returning."

author: Xerxes Dotiwalla
text: 'Service was a bit slow when it got busy. But the gluten free crust is pretty good for gluten free.'

author: Patel
column5: 'Pizza was delicious. The staff was friendly and even mad suggestions for other places to try in Hoboken. Will definitely be back.'

author: Ron
text: 'The pizza is delicious
column5: as well as the chicken wings
column6: and sangria. Very friendly wait staff.'

author: Matthew Quinlan
text: 'Great pizza and awesome daily specials'

author: Stephen Ramey
text: "Good spot for pizza and salad. They don't serve burgers."

author: Natalie Lane
text: 'Good pizza and pasta place! Chill vibes for dinner. Did the Saturday night trivia one time and it was a little odd due to the crowd.'

author: Azadeh Brown
text: 'Came for dinner with a large group including 2 toddlers. They had a section in the back that was perfect and separated us a bit from other diners
column5: which was ideal. The food was great. The service was fantastic
column6: and everyone left feeling great.'

author: Artie M.
text: 'We (3) went there after 11PM following a family dinner for after dinner cocktails. No room at the bar so we sat at a table. The wait staff could not have been more attentive. The drinks were substantial and the price was reasonable. Would definitely return again.'

author: Jim Lyons
text: 'Service was great and the pizza tasty! It was for a small business lunch so I would like to go back and try the beer/drink selections. Place was very clean
column5: neat and organized.'

author: Dan F.
text: "Gluten free brussel sprout pizza was overpriced
column5: I thought
column6: for the size. It was good
column7: but my gf (the reason for gluten free) and I both agreed that for the price
column8: just not worth it. The beer selection was pretty good and decently priced.\n\nI would probably go back if we weren't going to order gluten free to give their other options a try."

author: Chris Case
text: 'Decent food
column5: service was meh'

author: Jo Hayes
text: 'Good service
column5: really good food! Happy hour at the bar is the best!'

author: Tierra Chandler
text: "The ambiance is amazing. I did to to much enjoy the food. However
column5: great atmosphere. Before I arrived they were playing a trivia game which seemed really fun. It's a clean cool place to have a beer."

author: Bob London
text: 'Nice atmosphere but the food is pretty basic'

author: Barry Wexler
text: 'Waitress was especially helpful & accommodating. We were a large group and she anticipated our needs with our having to ask. The food was great
column5: especially the wings. Good food and great service - how can you go wrong?'

author: Eugene O'Connor
text: 'Fantastic pizza served here.\nGreat staff as well.'

author: Dennis W.
text: 'Great place to eat and watch TV; pasta dishes are ok
column5: but the pizzas are mediocre at best.'

author: Abhinav Mehta
text: 'Nice place to have choice of Pizza..'

author: Vondre Ossorio
text: "Highly recommend! My first time - I tried the San Danielle medium pie and coalhouse wings for delivery. Loved it since.\n\nMy go to is the Don Gregorio pie and wings. Let's not forget the best chicken noodle soup in Hoboken; bomb! Service has always been spot on. Go try it!!"

author: Matt Magrini
text: 'Although the food may be decent (meatballs
column5: pizza
column6: wings) the inattentive waitstaff takes away from the experience of dining here.'

author: Gregory Lorenzo
text: 'Pizza was great but rhe service was a bit on the slow side.'

author: Ted Conroy
text: 'For delivery
column5: Urban Coalhouse serves a good pizza! To stay
column6: I\'d stay away. I came here once with a friend
column7: waited 15 minutes at the host stand while they "prepared a table" only to be shown an empty table with no silverware
column9: or specials card.\n\nFast forward to us ordering
column10: we get meatballs as an appetizer
column11: and they come out ***before*** we have any place settings
column14: but management needs to sort out

author: Alexander Witzel
text: 'Beer was fine
column5: pasta sauce (bolognese) not so
column6: only traces of dressing on the salat'

author: Ward H. Blackwell
text: 'Not bad but nothing special'

author: Verde Luz
text: "Grilled Octopus salad
column5: Coal fired wings with optional sauses
column6: white sangria's and Urban Coal Cidar.. Priceless. Very cool staff."

author: Corey Hoey
text: "Been here twice and the food is meh... The service is painfully slow (they got my order wrong the first time) and it's pricey for what it is."

author: Diana “Dee” Falvo
text: "Excellent gluten free options! The gluten free pizza crust was fantastic (thin crust
column5: crispy). I'm also dairy free and was able to get a cheese-less pizza. Their chicken wings are also gluten free and yummy. Excellent quality."

author: maria kossek
text: 'Good food!  Good service!'

author: Miguel Perez ΛΣΥ (_iMiguell)
text: 'Ksí looks good'

author: Ethan Sawyer
text: 'Not many complaints. Some people complain about the food
column5: but the pizza was good and I would defiantly recommend the Garlic bread as a started. The only complaint I have is that it took a little long for the food to get there. But the food was worth the wait. If I lived in Hoboken and not MA
column6: I would definitely come again.'

author: Mike Jacobsen
text: 'Vodka pizza was good.  Service was not'

author: Paola Ricardo
text: "The pizza wasn't great. The sauce and dough felt pre-made. They also weren't able to accommodate removing meatballs from a pasta dish
column5: which made us wonder how fresh the food is. 2.5 stars for a this visit. Great place for a drink and watch a game."

author: Jason Castellani
text: 'The two major ingredients you have to get right for a high end pizza joint is crust and sauce. They missed on both. I was surprised that the crust was tasteless
column5: lacking that wood/coal burnt flavor.  The sauce was sweet and skimp on the pie. For the price and expectations
column6: a big disappointment.'

author: Robert Steckman
text: 'Great pizza
column5: definitely try the panko shrimp and the cauliflower pie. Both are delicious.'

author: Elodie Poons
text: 'Good food!!'

author: Benoit Veryser
text: 'Very good pizza! Try also the octopus
column5: it was great!'

author: James Manchester
text: 'Consistently good pizza and great drink selection'

author: Katie Welnhofer
text: 'Drinks were good and ambiance was cute. Last call for drinks is 10:15 PM on thursday.'

author: Sharon Zarate
text: "Great ambiance that's awesome to grab a couple of drinks one night
column5: yet still is family friendly. Amazing artisan pie selections
column6: cocktail menu
column7: and exceptional customer service!"

author: Luis Figueroa (Orgone Paradise)
text: 'This place rocks!! Great craft selection. Coal roasted thin crust pizza and award winning wings.'

author: Woody Pizzi
text: 'I love this place. Pizza is great and the service and beer selection are excellent'

author: Connor Boyd
text: 'Slow service for such a quiet place'

author: M E
text: "I like their pizza don't understand the bad reviews nice thin crust"

author: ecogal smyth
text: "I've always been a Happy customer when leaving the old Tommy's Coal Fire in Red Bank. When I saw the new owners opened up in Hoboken I was very happy
column5: went there Sat nite and the food wasn't good at all. Found it to be mediocre at best. The thing that's making me write this is this
column6: before you order take a walk to the back past where your prepared food waits to be brought to your table. I was sickened by what I watched as I waited for the restroom. 4-5 flies buzzin and landing all over this area where again your food sits waiting to be brought to your table. I know if it was summer I would have to be annoyed that they weren't doing anything about a normal summer nuisance
column7: but it being middle of sub freezing weather makes me think these flies are living in this place. I was very upset but didn't want to say anything due to the people I was with. I had just met some of them for the 1st time. Get it together that is disgusting and unacceptable. I just couldn't believe how they all just stood around & it didn't phase anyone."

author: Mary Bilali
text: 'Not a fan. I keep trying it because I live next door but on recent visit for dinner
column5: the pizza was cold and the roasted  cauliflower had little no flavor.'
